intro: Exhalimolobos berlandieri, commonly known as the Mexican fireweed, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in sunny, well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed areas. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies in its native habitat.
